value.value: Velmi rychlé, nedobrovolné svalové kontrakce v klidu, v reakci na stimuly nebo doprovázející cílené pohyby

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Very brief, involuntary random muscular contractions occurring at rest, in response to sensory stimuli, or accompanying voluntary movements.

value.value: Very brief, involuntary random muscular contractions occurring at rest, in response to sensory stimuli, or accompanying voluntary movements.
İstirahatte olan, duyusal uyarıya yanıt olarak veya istemli hareketlere eşlik olarak çok kısa, istemsiz rastgele kas kasılmaları

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Very brief, involuntary random muscular contractions occurring at rest, in response to sensory stimuli, or accompanying voluntary movements.

definition.value: Myoclonus may be synchronous (several muscle contracting simultaneously), spreading (several muscles contracting in sequence), or asynchronous (several muscles contracting with varying and unpredictable relative timing). Myoclonus is characterized by sudden unidirectional movement due to muscle contraction (positive myoclonus) or due to sudden brief muscle relaxation (negative myoclonus). Electrophysiological tests are very helpful in determining whether myoclonus is cortical, subcortical or spinal.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001337 (Tremor)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

value.value: An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement about a joint axis.
Eklem aksı ile ilgili yaklaşan ve uzaklaşan kasıtsız, titreşen kas hareketi

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement about a joint axis.

value.value: Neúmyslný, oscilující pohyb svalu kmitající kolem společné osy

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement about a joint axis.

definition.value: Tremor is differentiated from other involuntary movement disorders, such as chorea, athetosis, ballism, tics, and myoclonus, by its repetitive, stereotyped movements of a regular amplitude and frequency. Clonus, unlike tremor, represents a rhythmic movement, which is increased by muscle stretching.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001339 (Lissencephaly)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

value.value: A spectrum of malformations of cortical development caused by insufficient neuronal migration that subsumes the terms agyria, pachygyria and subcortical band heterotopia. See also neuropathological definitions for 2-, 3-, and 4-layered lissencephaly.

Lisencefalie (LIS, která zahrnuje termíny agyrie a pachygyrie), spolu se subkortikální „band“ heterotopií (SBH), zahrnuje spektrum malformací kortikálního vývoje způsobeného nedostatečnou migrací neuronů. Klíčovými rysy LIS je abnormálně tlustá kůra se sníženou nebo nepřítomnou tvorbou mozkových závitů, zatímco SBH se skládá z abnormálních pásem neuronů pod normálním kortexem, i když mozkové gyri mohou být oddělené neobvykle mělkým sulci

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A spectrum of malformations of cortical development caused by insufficient neuronal migration that subsumes the terms agyria, pachygyria and subcortical band heterotopia. See also neuropathological definitions for 2-, 3-, and 4-layered lissencephaly.

value.value: Serebral korteksin girintilerinin doğumsal yokluğu ve Silviyan fissürün yetersiz şekillenmesi

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A spectrum of malformations of cortical development caused by insufficient neuronal migration that subsumes the terms agyria, pachygyria and subcortical band heterotopia. See also neuropathological definitions for 2-, 3-, and 4-layered lissencephaly.

definition.value: Lissencephaly (LIS, which subsumes the terms agyria and pachygyria), together with subcortical-band heterotopia (SBH) comprises a spectrum of malformations of cortical development caused by insufficient neuronal migration. The key features of LIS are an abnormally thick cortex with reduced or absent formation of the cerebral convolutions, while SBH consists of abnormal bands of neurons beneath a normal cortex, although the cerebral gyri may be separated by unusually shallow sulci.

definition.value: A cerebral hemorrhage (or intracerebral hemorrhage, ICH), is a type of intracranial hemorrhage that occurs within the brain tissue itself.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001343 (Kernicterus)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

value.value: Damage to cerebral nuclei caused in infants by highly increased levels of unconjugated bilirubin. The basal ganglia and brainstem nuclei could be shown to have a yellow staining historically in infants who died of kernicterus, that is, kernicterus is strictly speaking a pathological diagnosis. The presence of kernicterus may be inferred in infants with characteristic acute or chronic bilirubin-induced neurological dysfunction.

Poškození mozkových jader způsobené u kojenců významně zvýšenými hladinami nekonjugovaného bilirubinu. Ukázalo se, že bazální ganglia a jádra mozkového kmene mají žluté zbarvení u pitvaných, na kernikterus zemřelých kojenců, proto je kernikterus v pravém slova smyslu patologickou diagnózou. Přítomnost kernikteru může být odvozena u kojenců s charakteristickou akutní nebo chronickou neurologickou dysfunkcí vyvolanou bilirubinem

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Damage to cerebral nuclei caused in infants by highly increased levels of unconjugated bilirubin. The basal ganglia and brainstem nuclei could be shown to have a yellow staining historically in infants who died of kernicterus, that is, kernicterus is strictly speaking a pathological diagnosis. The presence of kernicterus may be inferred in infants with characteristic acute or chronic bilirubin-induced neurological dysfunction.

value.value: Yüksek derecede artmış konjuge olmamış bilirubin seviyeleri nedeniyle oluşan bebeklerin serebral çekirdeklerine yönelik zarar. Tarihsel olarak kernikterustan ölen bebeklerde bazal gangliyon ve beyin sapı çekirdeklerinin sarıya boyandığı gösterilebilmiştir, bu da kernikterusun kesin patolojik bir tanı olduğunu gösterir. Kernikterus varlığı akut veya kronik bilirubin ile indüklenmiş nörolojik disfonksiyon ile karakterize bebeklerde anlaşılabilir

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Damage to cerebral nuclei caused in infants by highly increased levels of unconjugated bilirubin. The basal ganglia and brainstem nuclei could be shown to have a yellow staining historically in infants who died of kernicterus, that is, kernicterus is strictly speaking a pathological diagnosis. The presence of kernicterus may be inferred in infants with characteristic acute or chronic bilirubin-induced neurological dysfunction.

Complete lack of development of speech and language abilities.

definition.value: This term should not be used in very young children.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001345 (Psychotic mentation)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

definition.value: A pattern of thinking and perceiving characterized by a loss of contact with reality, leading to significant changes in thoughts, perceptions, and behaviors.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001347 (Hyperreflexia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

value.value: Hiperrefleksi kasların hiperaktif gerilme refleksleri varlığıdır

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Hyperreflexia is the presence of hyperactive stretch reflexes of the muscles.

value.value: Hyperreflexia is the presence of hyperactive stretch reflexes of the muscles.
Hyperreflexie je přítomnost patologického zvýšení svalovo-šlachových reflexů

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Hyperreflexia is the presence of hyperactive stretch reflexes of the muscles.

definition.value: Reflexes are graded according to the following scale: 0=absent; 1=present but diminished; 2=normoactive; 3=exaggerated; and 4=clonus. Clonus is always abnormal, and a grade 3 reflex may be abnormal if it is asymmetric or if it was previously grade 2 or less.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001348 (Brisk reflexes)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

value.value: Tendon refleksleri fark edilir şekilde olağandan daha aktiftir (geleneksel olarak klinik muayenede 3+ olarak ifade edilir). Canlı refleksler nörolojik bir lezyona işaret edebilir veya etmeyebilir. Hiperrefleksinin her zaman anormal olarak değerlendirilen hiperaktif tekrarlayan (klonik) refleksler ile karakterize olması gerçeği ile hiperrefleksiden ayrılmaktadır

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Tendon reflexes that are noticeably more active than usual (conventionally denoted 3+ on clinical examination). Brisk reflexes may or may not indicate a neurological lesion. They are distinguished from hyperreflexia by the fact that hyerreflexia is characterized by hyperactive repeating (clonic) reflexes, which are considered to be always abnormal.

definition.value: Tendon reflexes that are noticeably more active than usual (conventionally denoted 3+ on clinical examination). Brisk reflexes may or may not indicate a neurological lesion. They are distinguished from hyperreflexia by the fact that hyerreflexia is characterized by hyperactive repeating (clonic) reflexes, which are considered to be always abnormal.

value.value: Šlacho-svalové reflexy jsou znatelně aktivnější než obvyklé (obvykle označované 3+ při klinickém vyšetření). Rychlejší reflexy mohou ale nemusí ukazovat na neurologickou lézi. Rozlišují se od hyperreflexie tím, že hyerreflexie je charakterizována hyperaktivními opakujícími se (klonickými) reflexi, které jsou považovány za vždy abnormální

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Tendon reflexes that are noticeably more active than usual (conventionally denoted 3+ on clinical examination). Brisk reflexes may or may not indicate a neurological lesion. They are distinguished from hyperreflexia by the fact that hyerreflexia is characterized by hyperactive repeating (clonic) reflexes, which are considered to be always abnormal.

Pic de pre-myoclonie en EEG verrouillé sur la secousse musculaire

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001351 (Jerk-locked premyoclonus spikes)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

value.value: ミオクローヌス放電ロック前ミオクローヌス棘波
抽动锁时的肌阵挛前棘波

Jerk-locked averaging (JLA) is used to record the timing and distribution of brain activity preceding brisk involuntary movements such as those observed in patients with myoclonus. JLA is capable of revealing a premyoclonus spike in the absence of paroxysmal activity in the routine EEG.

Jerk-locked ortalama (JLA) myoklonusu olan hastalarda gözlenen canlı istemsiz hareketleri takip eden beyin aktivitesinde olduğu gibi zamanlamayı ve dağılımı kayıt etmek için kullanılır. JLA rutin EEG'de paroksismal aktivite yokluğunda premyoklonus diken ortaya çıkartabilir

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Jerk-locked averaging (JLA) is used to record the timing and distribution of brain activity preceding brisk involuntary movements such as those observed in patients with myoclonus. JLA is capable of revealing a premyoclonus spike in the absence of paroxysmal activity in the routine EEG.

value.value: Metoda zpětného zprůměrnění EEG (tzv. jerk-locked back averaging)(JLA) umožňuje detekci EEG výbojů (načasování a distribuci), které konstantně předcházejí mimovolní pohyb, například u pacientů s myoklonem. JLA je schopná odhalit tento typ aktivity i při absenci paroxysmální aktivity na rutinním EEG

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Jerk-locked averaging (JLA) is used to record the timing and distribution of brain activity preceding brisk involuntary movements such as those observed in patients with myoclonus. JLA is capable of revealing a premyoclonus spike in the absence of paroxysmal activity in the routine EEG.

definition.value: EEG-EMG jerk-locked averaging is a technique that combines EEG and EMG to assess myoclonus. The technique use electromyography (EMG) electrodes for the arms or legs, and correlates averaged EEG responses with EMG bursts used as a trigger.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001355 (Megalencephaly)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

value.value: Diffuse enlargement of the entire cerebral hemispheres leading to macrocephaly (with or without overlying cortical dysplasia).
Serebral hemisferlerin bütününün veya bir kısmının genişlemesi

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Diffuse enlargement of the entire cerebral hemispheres leading to macrocephaly (with or without overlying cortical dysplasia).

value.value: Zvětšení celých mozkových hemisfér nebo jejich částí

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Diffuse enlargement of the entire cerebral hemispheres leading to macrocephaly (with or without overlying cortical dysplasia).

definition.value: Megalencephaly is defined as fronto-occipital diameter above two standard deviations of the mean for the patient's age because of an oversized brain parenchyma. This is different from macrocephaly, which is defined by an enlarged head circumference and therefore accounts also for the size of the extra-axial spaces.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001357 (Plagiocephaly)  ; abnormality of head or neck ; abnormality of the skeletal system

value.value: Poinlab tulang tulu ikawas tulu amu nourod
Asymetrický tvar hlavy, který je obvykle kombinací jednostranného okcipitálního oploštění s ipsilaterální frontální prominencí, vedoucí k romboidnímu tvaru lebky

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Asymmetric head shape, which is usually a combination of unilateral occipital flattening with ipsilateral frontal prominence, leading to rhomboid cranial shape.

value.value: Asymmetric head shape, which is usually a combination of unilateral occipital flattening with ipsilateral frontal prominence, leading to rhomboid cranial shape.
Genellikle tek taraflı oksipital düzleşme ile aynı taraflı frontal belirginlik bileşimi ile olan eşkenar dörtgen kraniyal şekline yol açan simetrik kafa şekli

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Asymmetric head shape, which is usually a combination of unilateral occipital flattening with ipsilateral frontal prominence, leading to rhomboid cranial shape.

definition.value: Plagiocephaly may affect the posterior skull alone. With plagiocephaly, one can see a combination of unilateral occipital flattening with ipsilateral frontal prominence, leading to rhomboid cranial shape or asymmetry of the posterior skull alone.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001360 (Holoprosencephaly)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

value.value: Holoprosencephaly is a structural anomaly of the brain in which the developing forebrain fails to divide into two separate hemispheres and ventricles.
Holoprozencefálie je strukturální anomálie mozku, při které se přední mozek nerozdělí na dvě samostatné hemisféry a komory

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Holoprosencephaly is a structural anomaly of the brain in which the developing forebrain fails to divide into two separate hemispheres and ventricles.

value.value: Holoprozensefali gelişen ön beynin iki ayrı hemisfere ve ventriküle ayrılmada başarısız olduğu yapısal beyin anomalisidir

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Holoprosencephaly is a structural anomaly of the brain in which the developing forebrain fails to divide into two separate hemispheres and ventricles.

definition.value: The presence of a single cerebral ventricle (instead of the usual four) may be seen as part of holoprosencephaly.

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Head movements associated with nystagmus, that may represent an attempt to compensate for the involuntary eye movements and to improve vision.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001362 (Calvarial skull defect)  ; abnormality of head or neck ; abnormality of the skeletal system

value.value: A localized defect in the bone of the skull resulting from abnormal embryological development. The defect is covered by normal skin. In some cases, skull x-rays have shown underlying lytic bone lesions which have closed before the age of one year.

Anormal embriyolojik gelişimden kaynaklanan kafatası kemiklerinde lokalize bir defekt. Defekt normal deri ile örtülmüştür. Bazı vakalarda, kafatası filmleri bir yaşından önce kapanmış altta yatan litik kemik lezyonlarını göstermiştir

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A localized defect in the bone of the skull resulting from abnormal embryological development. The defect is covered by normal skin. In some cases, skull x-rays have shown underlying lytic bone lesions which have closed before the age of one year.

value.value: Lokalizovaný defekt v kosti lebky vyplývající z abnormálního embryologického vývoje. Defekt je pokryt normální pokožkou. V některých případech RTG lebky prokáže lytické kostní léze, které se uzavřely před rokem věku dítěte

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A localized defect in the bone of the skull resulting from abnormal embryological development. The defect is covered by normal skin. In some cases, skull x-rays have shown underlying lytic bone lesions which have closed before the age of one year.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001363 (Craniosynostosis)  ; abnormality of head or neck ; abnormality of the skeletal system

value.value: Craniosynostosis refers to the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Primary craniosynostosis refers to the closure of one or more sutures due to abnormalities in skull development, and secondary craniosynostosis results from failure of brain growth.

Kraniosynostóza odkazuje na předčasný uzávěr lebečních švů. Primární kraniosynostóza je předčasným uzávěrem jednoho či více švů při abnormálním vývoje lebky, sekundární kraniosynostóza je pak výsledkem poruchy vývoje mozku

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Craniosynostosis refers to the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Primary craniosynostosis refers to the closure of one or more sutures due to abnormalities in skull development, and secondary craniosynostosis results from failure of brain growth.

value.value: Kraniyosinositoz kraniyal süturların erken kapanmasına denir. Birincil kraniyosinositoz kafatası gelişimindeki anormalliklere bağlı olarak bir veya daha fazla süturun kapanmasına denmektedir ve ikincil kraniyosinositoz beyin gelişimi yetersizliğinden kaynaklanmaktadır

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Craniosynostosis refers to the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Primary craniosynostosis refers to the closure of one or more sutures due to abnormalities in skull development, and secondary craniosynostosis results from failure of brain growth.

definition.value: Skull deformity caused by the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Craniostenosis is a deformity of the skull caused by craniosynostosis, with consequent cessation of skull growth.

value.value: Abnormální struktura nebo tvar kloubů, tj. jednoho nebo více spojení kostí

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An abnormal structure or form of the joints, i.e., one or more of the articulations where two bones join.

value.value: An abnormal structure or form of the joints, i.e., one or more of the articulations where two bones join.
İki kemiğin birleştiği bir veya daha fazla eklemlenme olan eklemlerin anormal yapısı veya formu

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An abnormal structure or form of the joints, i.e., one or more of the articulations where two bones join.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001369 (Arthritis)  ; abnormality of the skeletal system
label of HP:0001370 (Rheumatoid arthritis)  ; abnormality of the skeletal system

value.value: Inflammatory changes in the synovial membranes and articular structures with widespread fibrinoid degeneration of the collagen fibers in mesenchymal tissues, as well as atrophy and rarefaction of bony structures.

Sinoviyal zarlarda ve eklemsel yapılarda mezenkimal dokularda kollajen fiberlerinin yaygın fibrinoid dejenerasyonu hatta kemik yapıların atrofisi ve yoğunluğunun azalması ile olan inflamatuvar değişiklikler

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Inflammatory changes in the synovial membranes and articular structures with widespread fibrinoid degeneration of the collagen fibers in mesenchymal tissues, as well as atrophy and rarefaction of bony structures.

value.value: Zánětlivé změny v synoviální membráně a kloubních strukturách s rozšířenou fibrinoidní degenerací kolagenových vláken v mesenchymálních tkáních a také atrofie a řídnutí kostních struktur

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001371 (Flexion contracture)  ; abnormality of the musculature ; abnormality of the skeletal system ; abnormality of connective tissue

value.value: A flexion contracture is a bent (flexed) joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement of joints.

Fleksiyon kontraktürü aktif veya pasif olarak düzleştirilemeyen bükülmüş (fleks halde) bir eklemdir. Bu yüzdendir ki eklemlerin normal hareketlerini engelleyen kas, tendon, ligament veya derideki yapısal değişiklikler kronik eklem hareket kaybına neden olur

value.value: Flekční kontraktura je flektovaný kloub který nelze extendovat aktivně ani pasivně. Jedná se o chronickou ztrátu pohyblivosti kloubu pro strukturální změny ve svalech, šlachách, vazech nebo kůži které znemožňují normální pohyb kloubu

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: The capability that a joint (or a group of joints) has to move, passively and/or actively, beyond normal limits along physiological axes.

value.value: Schopnost kloubů dosáhnout pozic mimo jejich standardní rozmezí pohybu

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: The capability that a joint (or a group of joints) has to move, passively and/or actively, beyond normal limits along physiological axes.

value.value: The capability that a joint (or a group of joints) has to move, passively and/or actively, beyond normal limits along physiological axes.

definition.value: Synonyms of joint hypermobility (JH) include joint laxity and double-jointedness. In general terms, joint hyperlaxity is often considered a further synonym of JH. JH may be caused by a number of factors including intraarticular disease and injury or slacking of extraarticular structures such as joint capsules, ligaments, and muscles. Establishing whether a joint is hypermobile or not is a relatively easy task and it is carried out by (i) using professional tools, such as the orthopedic goniometer; (ii) following specific procedures; and (iii) comparing the measured range of motion (ROM) with normal parameters. When JH is observed at one or a few types of joints (usually fewer than five) it may be defined as localized joint hypermobility (LJH). Typically, LJH affects a single small or large joint and may be bilateral (e.g., bilateral genu recurvatum due to knee hyperextensibility). LJH may be inherited, but it may be an acquired trait related to, for example, past trauma, joint disease, surgery, or training (e.g., spine hypermobility). In individuals with JH at multiple sites (usually five or more), the term generalized joint hypermobility (GJH) is preferred.

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A chronic disorder of the liver in which liver tissue becomes scarred and is partially replaced by regenerative nodules and fibrotic tissue resulting in loss of liver function.

definition.value: Cirrhosis is caused by chronic liver disease as a result of viral infections (hepatitis), alcohol abuse, certain medications, certain metabolic disorders of iron and copper, and many others. Cirrhosis may lead to a number of abnormalities including hepatomegaly, jaundice, abnormal liver function tests, ascites, dilatation of veins in the abdominal wall, anemia, and clotting deficiencies.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001397 (Hepatic steatosis)  ; abnormality of the digestive system

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Steatosis is a term used to denote lipid accumulation within hepatocytes.

value.value: Steatosis is a term used to denote lipid accumulation within hepatocytes.
Steatóza je termín označující hromadění lipidů v hepatocytech.

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Steatosis is a term used to denote lipid accumulation within hepatocytes.

definition.value: Although steatosis is the hallmark of the fatty liver disease, it is not a specific feature because it can be seen as part of other disease processes, such as drug injury, Wilson disease, or hepatitis C virus infection (especially genotype-3). Involvement of less than 5% of the hepatocytes by steatosis is considered clinically insignificant and within reference range. Based on the morphologic appearance and the size of the lipid droplets within the cytoplasm of the hepatocytes, steatosis is characterized as macrovesicular or microvesicular. Macrovesicular steatosis is characterized by large lipid droplets occupying the cytoplasm, displacing the nucleus to the periphery (large droplet macrovesicular steatosis) or multiple small lipid droplets of variable size occupying the cytoplasm with the nucleus maintaining its central location (small droplet macrovesicular steatosis). Microvesicular steatosis is characterized by innumerable tiny, relatively uniform lipid vacuoles that result in a bubbly appearance of the hepatocytes.
